verses.verse: Abram<WH87> went up<WH5927> out of Egypt:<WH4714> he,<WH802> his wife, all that he had,<WH3876> and Lot with him,<WH5045> into the South.
Abram<WH87> was very<WH3966> rich<WH3513> in livestock,<WH4735> in silver,<WH3701> and in gold.<WH2091>

He went<WH3212> on his journeys<WH4550> from the South<WH5045> even to Bethel,<WH1008> to the place<WH4725> where his tent<WH168> had been<WH1961> at the beginning,<WH8462> between Bethel<WH1008> and Ai,<WH5857>
to the place<WH4725> of the altar,<WH4196> which he had made<WH6213> there at the first.<WH7223> There Abram<WH87> called<WH7121> on the name<WH8034> of Yahweh.<WH3068>
Lot<WH3876> also,<WH1980> who went with<WH854> Abram,<WH87> had flocks,<WH6629> and herds,<WH1241> and tents.<WH168>

The land<WH776> was not able to bear<WH5375> them,<WH3427> that they might live together:<WH3162> for their substance<WH7399> was great,<WH7227> so that they could<WH3201> not live<WH3427> together.<WH3162>

There was a strife<WH7379> between the herdsmen<WH7462> of Abram<WH87>'s livestock<WH4735> and the herdsmen<WH7462> of Lot<WH3876>'s livestock:<WH4735> and the Canaanite<WH3669> and the Perizzite<WH6522> lived<WH3427> in the land at that time.<WH776>

Abram<WH87> said<WH559> to Lot,<WH3876> "Please,<WH1961> let there be no<WH408> strife<WH4808> between me and you,<WH7462> and between my herdsmen and your herdsmen;<WH7462> for we<WH582> are relatives.<WH251>

Isn't<WH776> the whole land before you?<WH6440> Please separate yourself<WH6504> from me.<WH8040> If you go to the left hand, then I will go to the right.<WH3231> Or if you go to the right hand,<WH3225> then I will go to the left.<WH8041>"

Lot<WH3876> lifted up<WH5375> his eyes,<WH5869> and saw<WH7200> all the plain<WH3603> of the Jordan,<WH3383> that it was well-watered<WH4945> everywhere,<WH6440> before Yahweh<WH3068> destroyed<WH7843> Sodom<WH5467> and Gomorrah,<WH6017> like the garden<WH1588> of Yahweh,<WH3068> like the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> as you go<WH935> to Zoar.<WH6820>
So Lot<WH3876> chose<WH977> the Plain<WH3603> of the Jordan<WH3383> for himself.<WH3876> Lot traveled<WH5265> east,<WH6924> and they separated themselves<WH6504> the one<WH376> from the other.<WH251>
Abram<WH87> lived<WH3427> in the land<WH776> of Canaan,<WH3667> and Lot<WH3876> lived<WH3427> in the cities<WH5892> of the plain,<WH3603> and moved his tent<WH167> as far<WH5704> as Sodom.<WH5467>
Now the men<WH582> of Sodom<WH5467> were exceedingly<WH3966> wicked<WH7451> and sinners<WH2400> against Yahweh.<WH3068>

Yahweh<WH3068> said<WH559> to Abram,<WH87> after<WH310> Lot<WH3876> was separated<WH6504> from him,<WH5375> "Now, lift up your eyes,<WH5869> and look<WH7200> from the place<WH4725> where you are,<WH6828> northward and southward<WH5045> and eastward<WH6924> and westward,<WH3220>
for all the land<WH776> which you see,<WH7200> I will give<WH5414> to you,<WH5704> and to your offspring<WH2233> forever.<WH5769>

I will make<WH7760> your offspring<WH2233> as the dust<WH6083> of the earth,<WH776> so that<WH834> if a man<WH376> can<WH3201> number<WH4487> the dust<WH6083> of the earth,<WH776> then your seed<WH2233> may also be numbered.<WH4487>
Arise,<WH6965> walk<WH1980> through the land<WH776> in its length<WH753> and in its breadth;<WH7341> for I will give it to you.<WH5414>"
Abram<WH87> moved his tent,<WH167> and came<WH935> and lived<WH3427> by the oaks<WH436> of Mamre,<WH4471> which are in Hebron,<WH2275> and built<WH1129> an altar<WH4196> there to Yahweh.<WH3068>
